workflow.name: Create Zendesk tickets from Gmail and Slack with Google Sheets tracking
workflow.description:
## Description
Automatically convert Gmail emails and Slack messages into Zendesk support tickets with intelligent priority detection, comprehensive Google Sheets tracking, and real-time team notifications. Streamlines support workflows with zero manual ticket creation. üé´üìß

## What This Template Does
- Monitors Gmail inbox for unread emails and Slack support channel for new messages. üì•
- Normalizes data from both sources with intelligent content processing and HTML cleanup. üßº
- Creates structured Zendesk tickets with proper subject lines, descriptions, and priority tagging. üé´
- Generates comprehensive tracking logs in Google Sheets with clickable ticket URLs. üìä
- Sends formatted Slack notifications for successful ticket creation or error alerts. üì¢

## Key Benefits
- Eliminates manual ticket creation with automated processing. ‚è±Ô∏è
- Unified support workflow across Gmail and Slack channels. üîÑ
- Complete audit trail with Google Sheets tracking. üßæ
- Real-time team notifications with ticket details and direct links. üì≤
- Intelligent priority detection based on "urgent" keywords. üö®
- Error handling with detailed failure notifications. üõ°Ô∏è

## Features
- Gmail polling every minute for unread email detection. üìß
- Real-time Slack message monitoring in designated support channel. üí¨
- Smart data normalization with HTML tag removal and urgency detection. üß†
- Automatic Zendesk ticket creation with priority-based tagging. üè∑Ô∏è
- Google Sheets logging with ticket URLs, timestamps, and metadata. üìà
- Formatted Slack notifications with emojis and clickable links. ‚ú®
- Comprehensive error detection and team alerting system. üö®

## Requirements
- n8n instance (cloud or self-hosted).
- Gmail OAuth2 credentials in n8n with inbox access permissions.
- Slack Bot API credentials with channels:history, chat:write, and webhook capabilities.
- Zendesk API credentials for ticket creation and management.
- Google Sheets OAuth2 credentials with spreadsheet write permissions.
- Designated Slack channel for support requests (e.g., "#post-ticket").

## Target Audience
- Customer support teams automating multi-channel ticket creation. üéß
- Help desk operations seeking unified request processing. üÜò
- Small to medium businesses streamlining support workflows. üè¢
- IT support teams managing internal and external requests. üíª
- Service organizations requiring comprehensive audit trails. üìã
- Remote teams needing automated workflow notifications. üåê

## Step-by-Step Setup Instructions
- Connect Gmail, Slack, Zendesk, and Google Sheets credentials in n8n. üîë
- Configure Slack channel ID for support message monitoring (default: "#post-ticket"). üì±
- Set up Google Sheets document for ticket tracking and logging. üìä
- Import the workflow and assign all required credentials to respective nodes. üì¶
- Configure Zendesk subdomain in the "Format Sheet Data" node for proper ticket URLs. üîó
- Test with a sample email or Slack message to validate end-to-end automation. ‚úÖ

workflow.name: Automate Zendesk ticket creation from Gmail and Slack with tracking

user.name: Rahul Joshi
user.bio: Rahul Joshi is a seasoned technology leader specializing in the n8n automation tool and AI-driven workflow automation. With deep expertise in building open-source workflow automation and self-hosted automation platforms, he helps organizations eliminate manual processes through intelligent n8n ai agent automation solutions.

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
